title: Wild "Scanning Files"
body: I'm using MAC and my league client sometimes does this wild "(Number) scanning files" that moves at great speeds and can occasionally go up to "3000 scanning files", and when this occurs, it will occur every time I close and reopen it again to attempt avoiding it but it always comes back. I have to uninstall and reinstall my client which is annoying. PLEASE HELP!

replies.body:
Hi Arcancione! 

Thanks for the report! However, what you are describing to me sounds like the normal behavior of the launcher:

Don't cancel that scanning file. That happens when the launcher is trying to ensure your installation / patching is done correctly, when you cancel it, it needs to do all of it again. Be patient and just let it finish and the game will start.

If the scanning files gets stuck at a number for a good 10 minutes, then I would be concerned, otherwise what you are describing sounds like normal behavior of the client.

I waited for 1.5 hours for scanning files. And it ended :)

Note: Windows Client

Since the mac client is BUGGED right now, how do we bypass this?

If I bugsplat during the game, force LoL closed, and the patcher decides to scan 3000 files and download a 50 MB patch... I get a leave on my profile, and my team loses, because it takes 15+ minutes.

The secret code "thereisnourflevel" no longer works.

Thanks for the ranked loss last night when this happened by the way :D.
